description.zh-cn: 中国末代皇帝溥仪的三妹，爱新觉罗氏。满洲国覆灭后生活困顿，后经章士钊上报，获毛泽东批示，成为北京市东城区政协委员，生活得以改善。
description.en: The third younger sister of Puyi, the last emperor of China, of the Aisin-Gioro clan. She faced hardship after the fall of Manchukuo, but her situation improved after Zhang Shizhao reported her case, leading to an instruction from Mao Zedong that made her a member of the Dongcheng District CPPCC Committee in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 清朝摄政王，醇亲王，末代皇帝溥仪和金韫颖的父亲。
description.en: Prince-Regent of the Qing Dynasty, Prince Chun, and the father of the last emperor Puyi and Jin Yunying.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝及满洲国皇帝，金韫颖的兄长。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing Dynasty and the emperor of Manchukuo, elder brother of Jin Yunying.

description.zh-cn: 皇后婉容的弟弟，金韫颖的丈夫。1945年在逃亡途中失踪。
description.en: The younger brother of Empress Wanrong and the husband of Jin Yunying. He went missing during an escape in 1945.

description.zh-cn: 载沣的嫡福晋，溥仪和金韫颖的生母。
description.en: The primary consort of Zaifeng, and the biological mother of Puyi and Jin Yunying.

description.zh-cn: 金韫颖与润麒的儿子。
description.en: The son of Jin Yunying and Runqi.

description.zh-cn: 清朝宗室，溥仪的叔父，金韫颖的七叔。
description.en: A member of the Qing imperial clan, uncle of Puyi, and the seventh uncle of Jin Yunying.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事及政治人物，曾发动北京政变并将溥仪驱逐出紫禁城。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China who launched the Beijing Coup and expelled Puyi from the Forbidden City.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇后，溥仪的妻子，润麒的姐姐。
description.en: The last empress of the Qing Dynasty, wife of Puyi, and elder sister of Runqi.

description.zh-cn: 前清大臣，婉容和润麒的父亲。
description.en: A former official of the Qing Dynasty, father of Wanrong and Runqi.

description.zh-cn: 溥仪的弟弟，曾与润麒一同赴日本学习军事。
description.en: Puyi's younger brother, who went to Japan with Runqi to study military affairs.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治活动家、学者，曾任中央文史研究馆馆长，帮助金韫颖联系上毛泽东。
description.en: A Chinese political activist and scholar who served as the director of the Central Research Institute of Culture and History and helped Jin Yunying contact Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国、中国人民解放军的主要缔造者和领导人。其批示改善了金韫颖的生活状况。
description.en: A key founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Republic of China, and the People's Liberation Army. His instructions improved Jin Yunying's living conditions.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第一任国务院总理。毛泽东曾就金韫颖的情况批示由其酌情处理。
description.en: The first Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China. Mao Zedong instructed him to handle Jin Yunying's situation as appropriate.

description.zh-cn: 英国外交官，曾任溥仪的老师，为金韫颖取英文名。
description.en: A British diplomat who served as Puyi's tutor and gave Jin Yunying her English name.

description.zh-cn: 清朝皇室姓氏，满族的一个氏族。
description.en: The imperial clan of the Qing Dynasty, a Manchu clan.

description.zh-cn: 1932年至1945年间由大日本帝国在中国东北地区扶植的傀儡政权。
description.en: A puppet state of the Empire of Japan in Northeast China from 1932 to 1945.

description.zh-cn: 1918年至1946年间苏联的武装力量。
description.en: The armed forces of the Soviet Union from 1918 to 1946.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议北京市东城区委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议北京市东城区委员会

description.zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议在北京市东城区的地方组织。
description.en: The local organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference in Dongcheng District, Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院直属的具有统战性、荣誉性的文史研究机构。
description.en: A united front and honorary cultural and historical research institution directly under the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 位于中国辽宁省抚顺市的监狱，曾用以关押满洲国、第二次国共内战和中日战争的战犯，包括溥仪。
description.en: A prison in Fushun, Liaoning, China, used to incarcerate war criminals from Manchukuo, the Second Chinese Civil War, and the Second Sino-Japanese War, including Puyi.

description.zh-cn: 1913年，韫颖生于北京紫禁城。
description.en: In 1913, Yunying was born in the Forbidden City in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 金韫颖是载沣的第三个女儿。
description.en: Jin Yunying is the third daughter of Zaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 金韫颖和溥仪同为嫡福晋瓜尔佳氏所生。
description.en: Jin Yunying and Puyi were both born to the primary consort Guwalgiya.

description.zh-cn: 溥仪和金韫颖同为嫡福晋瓜尔佳氏所生。
description.en: Puyi and Jin Yunying were both born to the primary consort Guwalgiya.

description.zh-cn: 金韫颖是溥仪的三妹。
description.en: Jin Yunying is Puyi's third younger sister.

description.zh-cn: 金韫颖19岁时由溥仪指定与润麒订亲，婚礼在满洲国新京举行。
description.en: At the age of 19, Jin Yunying was engaged to Runqi by Puyi's arrangement, and their wedding was held in Xinjing, Manchukuo.

description.zh-cn: 宗弇是金韫颖的儿子。
description.en: Zongyan is the son of Jin Yunying.

description.zh-cn: 宗弇是金韫颖与润麒的儿子。
description.en: Zongyan is the son of Jin Yunying and Runqi.

description.zh-cn: 载涛是金韫颖的七叔。
description.en: Zaitao is Jin Yunying's seventh paternal uncle.

description.zh-cn: 润麒是前清大臣荣源的二儿子。
description.en: Runqi is the second son of the former Qing minister Rongyuan.

description.zh-cn: 润麒是皇后婉容的弟弟。
description.en: Runqi is the younger brother of Empress Wanrong.

description.zh-cn: 婉容是溥仪的皇后。
description.en: Wanrong was Puyi's empress.

description.zh-cn: 金韫颖是爱新觉罗氏的成员。
description.en: Jin Yunying is a member of the Aisin-Gioro clan.

description.zh-cn: 1924年11月，冯玉祥将溥仪驱逐出紫禁城。
description.en: In November 1924, Feng Yuxiang expelled Puyi from the Forbidden City.

description.zh-cn: 溥仪为金韫颖指定了与润麒的婚事。
description.en: Puyi arranged the marriage between Jin Yunying and Runqi.

description.zh-cn: 溥仪派润麒赴日本学习军事。
description.en: Puyi sent Runqi to Japan to study military affairs.

description.zh-cn: 溥仪派溥杰和润麒赴日本学习军事。
description.en: Puyi sent Pujie and Runqi to Japan to study military affairs.

description.zh-cn: 1931年，溥仪在日本军警的保护下潜赴中国东北，建立满洲国。
description.en: In 1931, under the protection of Japanese military police, Puyi secretly went to Northeast China to establish Manchukuo.

description.zh-cn: 1945年日本投降后，苏联红军接管东北，导致满洲国覆灭。
description.en: After Japan's surrender in 1945, the Soviet Red Army took control of Northeast China, leading to the collapse of Manchukuo.

description.zh-cn: 1954年，章士钊将金韫颖的自述呈送毛泽东，促成其生活状况的改善。
description.en: In 1954, Zhang Shizhao presented Jin Yunying's autobiography to Mao Zedong, which led to the improvement of her living conditions.

description.zh-cn: 在阅读金韫颖的自述后，毛泽东批示改善其生活，并安排其为北京市东城区政协委员。1956年，他又批准金韫颖探望溥仪。
description.en: After reading Jin Yunying's autobiography, Mao Zedong instructed to improve her life and arranged for her to become a member of the Dongcheng District CPPCC Committee in Beijing. In 1956, he also approved her visit to Puyi.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议北京市东城区委员会

description.zh-cn: 1954年后，金韫颖被安排为北京市东城区政协委员。
description.en: After 1954, Jin Yunying was appointed as a member of the CPPCC Dongcheng District Committee in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 1956年，经毛泽东批准，金韫颖赴抚顺战犯管理所看望了溥仪。
description.en: In 1956, with Mao Zedong's approval, Jin Yunying visited Puyi at the Fushun War Criminals Management Center.

description.zh-cn: 1956年，载涛与金韫颖一同赴抚顺战犯管理所看望了溥仪。
description.en: In 1956, Zaitao, along with Jin Yunying, visited Puyi at the Fushun War Criminals Management Center.

description.zh-cn: 庄士敦为金韫颖题赠了英文名“Lily”。
description.en: Reginald Johnston gave Jin Yunying the English name 'Lily'.
